alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 1:27PM MDT until May 07 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Methow River near Pateros affecting Okanogan County. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Major flooding is forecast. Minor flooding is forecast for the St. Joe near St. Maries and near Pateros on the Methow River. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 32.5 feet, Minor flooding will occur throughout the low lying areas of the St Joe Valley. Water will be observed behind levees due to seepage. Minor flooding of the Aqua Park`s boat launch and swim beach along the river`s edge. Outbuildings along the river that are not behind levees may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 32.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 32.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.7 feet on 04/11/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue St Joe River St Maries 32.5 32.5 Sat 11 am PD 32.4 32.0 31.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning at 600 AM PDT.
